Foolish Child

Aug 2, 2019 • Emelinda

Foolish child with no human eyes
What did you expect?
Life should be fair? Creatures be nice?
And know how to act?

You primitive mind of a different time
There is no such fantasy
Of blind love and fearless acts
Or superior loyalty

These beautiful lies you painfully torn
Of what is what and what is not
Since the day you were born
One at a time, a piece here and there
You have picked yourself apart
I can see your despair

There is no room for such infantile thought
Among the gown and the adult
No, grow cold and calculate

Purity of mind and soul is nothing to obtain
It's a pointless goal
Be thick skinned and focus like a rifle
Don't trifle.

Be your own favorite, love yourself
Forget what they teach
Don't expect to be given a treat
Because in this world you are simply meat.

- Emelinda

and © Tejas
